title.rendered: “IDF Chief of Staff Emphasizes Community Protection in Gaza Border Mission”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The Chief of Staff to the fighters of the ‘Nitzach Yehuda’ Battalion on the Gaza border: The first mission is the protection of the communities, not to allow the enemy to infiltrate.

Yesterday (Wednesday), Chief of Staff, Lieutenant General Herzl Halevi visited the ‘Nitzach Yehuda’ Battalion (97) of the Kfir Brigade operating in the northern brigade of Division 143, accompanied by the division commander, Brigadier General Avi Rosenfeld, the northern brigade commander, Colonel Chaim Cohen, and other commanders. During the visit, the Chief of Staff engaged in dialogue with the battalion fighters and commended them for their efforts.

Attached is a video of the Chief of Staff’s remarks: https://bit.ly/458j6dD

Attached is a video on the topic: https://bit.ly/3RctDP2

Attached are images on the topic: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC96854

The full remarks of the Chief of Staff are attached: “I want to talk to you about two missions; the first mission is the protection of the communities here. You have nearby communities, you have a city close by, with a tremendous responsibility to defend in the border area, to maintain a very stable security zone, so that the enemy does not enter, so that they do not cross it, so that they do not approach the fence. It is important to know that when there is an infiltration attempt, we must respond quickly, respond decisively, respond professionally, to not allow the enemy to infiltrate, and to provide the residents here with a great deal of security. The IDF needs more fighters today; we want you to see that one can be an ultra-Orthodox fighter. You can both learn and protect the security of the state. Continue doing good, both to protect the residents here and to be pioneers, ultra-Orthodox fighters, each in their own way of defining themselves. We will strengthen the battalion and show that you are doing more every period, growing stronger and proving that this is the right path.”
